citations.narrative:
Several primary enclosures need maintenance and/or repair:
• A primary enclosure housing an adult black bear had a wooden framed doorway that can be left closed or opened to
allow the bear access to both sides of the enclosure, or to limit its access to one side. The wooden frame has been
chewed or scratched, leaving a rough surface with sharp jagged edges along the inner surface of the doorway.
• A primary enclosure housing an adult male lion had a wooden platform in front of the den. The frame of this platform is
made of 2”X4” boards. The front board is broken, leaving sharp jagged edges.
• A primary enclosure housing a white raccoon had an elevated platform composed of 6”X6” boards that are showing
signs of rot and decay.
• A primary enclosure housing an adult tiger has a cement pool. The front of the pool has a horizontal wooden board that
is attached to a vertical pole by a metal bracket. The bracket was broken and covered with flacking rust, the board and
vertical pole were covered in what appeared to be algae and showing signs of rot or decay.
Failure to maintain housing facilities in good repair can affect the structural integrity of the enclosures which may lead to
the injury or escape of the animals contained in them. Broken and torn enclosures may also have rough or sharp edges
which may also lead to injury of the animal.
The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to
contain the animals. To be corrected by 16 May 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
